00001 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00002  *      Name:    LCD_4bit.c
00003  *      Purpose: LCD Functions for 2 line 16 character Text LCD, with 4-bit interface
00004  *      Version: V1.10
00005  *----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00006  *      This file is part of the uVision/ARM development tools.
00007  *      This software may only be used under the terms of a valid, current,

00013 
00014 #include <LPC23xx.H>                     /* LPC23xx definitions               */
00015 
00016 /*********************** Hardware specific configuration **********************/
00017 
00018 /*------------------------- Speed dependant settings -------------------------*/
00019 
00020 /* If processor works on high frequency delay has to be increased, it can be 
00021    increased by factor 2^N by this constant                                   */
00022 #define DELAY_2N     0
00023 
00024 /*------------------------- Text LCD size definitions ------------------------*/
00025 
00026 #define LineLen     16                  /* Width (in characters)              */
00027 #define NumLines     2                  /* Hight (in lines)                   */
00028 
00029 /*-------------------- LCD interface hardware definitions --------------------*/
00030 
00031 /* PINS: 
00032    - DB4 = P1.24
00033    - DB5 = P1.25
00034    - DB6 = P1.26
00035    - DB7 = P1.27
00036    - E   = P1.31 (for V1 P1.30)
00037    - RW  = P1.29
00038    - RS  = P1.28                                                              */
00039 
00040 
00041 //#define MCB2300_V1                      /* First version of MCB2300          */
00042 
00043 #define PIN_E                 0x80000000
00044 #define PIN_RW                0x20000000
00045 #define PIN_RS                0x10000000
00046 #define PINS_CTRL             0xB0000000
00047 #define PINS_DATA             0x0F000000
00048 
00049 #ifdef  MCB2300_V1
00050   #undef  PIN_E
00051   #define PIN_E               0xC0000000
00052   #undef  PINS_CTRL
00053   #define PINS_CTRL           0xF0000000
00054 #endif
00055 
00056 /* pin E  setting to 0 or 1                                                   */
00057 #define LCD_E(x)              ((x) ? (IOSET1 = PIN_E)  : (IOCLR1 = PIN_E) );
00058 
00059 /* pin RW setting to 0 or 1                                                   */
00060 #define LCD_RW(x)             ((x) ? (IOSET1 = PIN_RW) : (IOCLR1 = PIN_RW));
00061 
00062 /* pin RS setting to 0 or 1                                                   */
00063 #define LCD_RS(x)             ((x) ? (IOSET1 = PIN_RS) : (IOCLR1 = PIN_RS));
00064 
00065 /* Reading DATA pins                                                          */
00066 #define LCD_DATA_IN           ((IOPIN1 >> 24) & 0xF)
00067 
00068 /* Writing value to DATA pins                                                 */
00069 #define LCD_DATA_OUT(x)       IOCLR1 = PINS_DATA; IOSET1 = (x & 0xF) << 24;
00070 
00071 /* Setting all pins to output mode                                            */
00072 #define LCD_ALL_DIR_OUT       IODIR1  |=  PINS_CTRL | PINS_DATA;
00073 
00074 /* Setting DATA pins to input mode                                            */
00075 #define LCD_DATA_DIR_IN       IODIR1 &= ~PINS_DATA;
00076 
00077 /* Setting DATA pins to output mode                                           */
00078 #define LCD_DATA_DIR_OUT      IODIR1 |=  PINS_DATA;
00079 
00080 /******************************************************************************/
00081 
00082 
00083 /* 8 user defined characters to be loaded into CGRAM (used for bargraph)      */
00084 const unsigned char UserFont[8][8] = {
00085   { 0x00,0x00,0x00,0x00,0x00,0x00,0x00,0x00 },
00086   { 0x10,0x10,0x10,0x10,0x10,0x10,0x10,0x10 },
00087   { 0x18,0x18,0x18,0x18,0x18,0x18,0x18,0x18 },
00088   { 0x1C,0x1C,0x1C,0x1C,0x1C,0x1C,0x1C,0x1C },
00089   { 0x1E,0x1E,0x1E,0x1E,0x1E,0x1E,0x1E,0x1E },
00090   { 0x1F,0x1F,0x1F,0x1F,0x1F,0x1F,0x1F,0x1F },
00091   { 0x00,0x00,0x00,0x00,0x00,0x00,0x00,0x00 },
00092   { 0x00,0x00,0x00,0x00,0x00,0x00,0x00,0x00 }
00093 };
00094 
00095 
00096 /************************ Global function definitions *************************/
00097 
00098 
00099 /*******************************************************************************
00100 * Delay in while loop cycles                                                   *
00101 *   Parameter:    cnt:    number of while cycles to delay                      *
00102 *   Return:                                                                    *
00103 *******************************************************************************/
00104 
00105 static void delay (int cnt)
00106 {
00107   cnt <<= DELAY_2N;
00108 
00109   while (cnt--);
00110 }
00111 
00112 
00113 /*******************************************************************************
00114 * Read status of LCD controller                                                *
00115 *   Parameter:    none                                                         *
00116 *   Return:       Status byte contains busy flag and address pointer           *
00117 *******************************************************************************/
00118 
00119 static unsigned char lcd_read_status (void)
00120 {
00121   unsigned char status;
00122 
00123   LCD_DATA_DIR_IN
00124   LCD_RS(0)
00125   LCD_RW(1)
00126   delay(10);
00127   LCD_E(1)
00128   delay(10);
00129   status  = LCD_DATA_IN << 4;
00130   LCD_E(0)
00131   delay(10);
00132   LCD_E(1)
00133   delay(10);
00134   status |= LCD_DATA_IN;
00135   LCD_E(0)
00136   LCD_DATA_DIR_OUT
00137   return (status);
00138 }
00139 
00140 
00141 /*******************************************************************************
00142 * Wait until LCD controller busy flag is 0                                     *
00143 *   Parameter:                                                                 *
00144 *   Return:       Status byte of LCD controller (busy + address)               *
00145 *******************************************************************************/
00146 
00147 static unsigned char wait_while_busy (void)
00148 {
00149   unsigned char status;
00150 
00151   do  {
00152     status = lcd_read_status();
00153   }  while (status & 0x80);             /* Wait for busy flag                 */
00154 
00155   return (status);
00156 }
00157 
00158 
00159 /*******************************************************************************
00160 * Write 4-bits to LCD controller                                               *
00161 *   Parameter:    c:      command to be written                                *
00162 *   Return:                                                                    *
00163 *******************************************************************************/
00164 
00165 void lcd_write_4bit (unsigned char c)
00166 {
00167   LCD_RW(0)
00168   LCD_E(1)
00169   LCD_DATA_OUT(c&0x0F)
00170   delay(10);
00171   LCD_E(0)
00172   delay(10);
00173 }
00174 
00175 
00176 /*******************************************************************************
00177 * Write command to LCD controller                                              *
00178 *   Parameter:    c:      command to be written                                *
00179 *   Return:                                                                    *
00180 *******************************************************************************/
00181 
00182 void lcd_write_cmd (unsigned char c)
00183 {
00184   wait_while_busy();
00185 
00186   LCD_RS(0)
00187   lcd_write_4bit (c>>4);
00188   lcd_write_4bit (c);
00189 }
00190 
00191 
00192 /*******************************************************************************
00193 * Write data to LCD controller                                                 *
00194 *   Parameter:    c:      data to be written                                   *
00195 *   Return:                                                                    *
00196 *******************************************************************************/
00197 
00198 static void lcd_write_data (unsigned char c)
00199 {
00200   wait_while_busy();
00201 
00202   LCD_RS(1)
00203   lcd_write_4bit (c>>4);
00204   lcd_write_4bit (c);
00205 }
00206 
00207 
00208 /*******************************************************************************
00209 * Print Character to current cursor position                                   *
00210 *   Parameter:    c:      character to be printed                              *
00211 *   Return:                                                                    *
00212 *******************************************************************************/
00213 
00214 void lcd_putchar (char c)
00215 { 
00216   lcd_write_data (c);
00217 }
00218 
00219 
00220 /*******************************************************************************
00221 * Initialize the LCD controller                                                *
00222 *   Parameter:                                                                 *
00223 *   Return:                                                                    *
00224 *******************************************************************************/
00225 
00226 void lcd_init (void)
00227 { 
00228   int i;
00229   unsigned char const *p;
00230 
00231   /* Set all pins for LCD as outputs                                          */
00232   LCD_ALL_DIR_OUT
00233 
00234   delay (15000);
00235   LCD_RS(0)
00236   lcd_write_4bit (0x3);                 /* Select 4-bit interface             */
00237   delay (4100);
00238   lcd_write_4bit (0x3);
00239   delay (100);
00240   lcd_write_4bit (0x3);
00241   lcd_write_4bit (0x2);
00242 
00243   lcd_write_cmd (0x28);                 /* 2 lines, 5x8 character matrix      */
00244   lcd_write_cmd (0x0C);                 /* Display ctrl:Disp=ON,Curs/Blnk=OFF */
00245   lcd_write_cmd (0x06);                 /* Entry mode: Move right, no shift   */
00246 
00247   /* Load user-specific characters into CGRAM                                 */
00248   lcd_write_cmd(0x40);                  /* Set CGRAM address counter to 0     */
00249   p = &UserFont[0][0];
00250   for (i = 0; i < sizeof(UserFont); i++, p++)
00251     lcd_putchar (*p);
00252 
00253   lcd_write_cmd(0x80);                  /* Set DDRAM address counter to 0     */
00254 }
00255 
00256 
00257 
00258 /*******************************************************************************
00259 * Set cursor position on LCD display                                           *
00260 *   Parameter:    column: column position                                      *
00261 *                 line:   line position                                        *
00262 *   Return:                                                                    *
00263 *******************************************************************************/
00264 
00265 void set_cursor (unsigned char column, unsigned char line)
00266 {
00267   unsigned char address;
00268 
00269   address = (line * 40) + column;
00270   address = 0x80 + (address & 0x7F);
00271   lcd_write_cmd(address);               /* Set DDRAM address counter to 0     */
00272 }
00273 
00274 /*******************************************************************************
00275 * Clear the LCD display                                                        *
00276 *   Parameter:                                                                 *
00277 *   Return:                                                                    *
00278 *******************************************************************************/
00279 
00280 void lcd_clear (void)
00281 {
00282   lcd_write_cmd(0x01);                  /* Display clear                      */
00283   set_cursor (0, 0);
00284 }
00285 
00286 
00287 /*******************************************************************************
00288 * Print sting to LCD display                                                   *
00289 *   Parameter:    string: pointer to output string                             *
00290 *   Return:                                                                    *
00291 *******************************************************************************/
00292 
00293 void lcd_print (unsigned char const *string)
00294 {
00295   while (*string)  {
00296     lcd_putchar (*string++);
00297   }
00298 }
